questions.questionText: When was the Constitution of India adopted?
questions.explanation: The Constitution was adopted on 26 November 1949 but came into effect on 26 January 1950

questions.questionText: How many Fundamental Rights are there in the Indian Constitution?
questions.explanation: There are 6 Fundamental Rights after the Right to Property was removed by the 44th Amendment

questions.questionText: What is the maximum strength of the Lok Sabha?
questions.explanation: The maximum strength of Lok Sabha is 552 members (530 states + 20 UTs + 2 Anglo-Indians)

questions.questionText: Who is the Chairman of the Rajya Sabha?
questions.explanation: The Vice President of India is the ex-officio Chairman of the Rajya Sabha

questions.questionText: What is the term of office of the President of India?
questions.explanation: The President of India holds office for a term of 5 years

questions.questionText: Which Article of the Constitution provides Right to Constitutional Remedies?
questions.explanation: Article 32 provides the Right to Constitutional Remedies, allowing citizens to approach the Supreme Court

questions.questionText: What is the maximum strength of the Rajya Sabha?
questions.explanation: The maximum strength of Rajya Sabha is 250 members (238 elected + 12 nominated)

questions.questionText: How many judges including the Chief Justice are there in the Supreme Court?
questions.explanation: The Supreme Court has 34 judges including the Chief Justice of India

questions.questionText: Who appoints the Prime Minister of India?
questions.explanation: The Prime Minister is appointed by the President, usually the leader of the majority party in Lok Sabha

questions.questionText: The Right to Education is guaranteed under which Article?
questions.explanation: Article 21A provides free and compulsory education to children aged 6-14 years

questions.questionText: Which amendment removed the Right to Property from Fundamental Rights?
questions.explanation: The 44th Amendment Act, 1978 removed the Right to Property from Fundamental Rights

questions.questionText: Who presides over the joint sitting of both houses of Parliament?
questions.explanation: The Speaker of Lok Sabha presides over the joint sitting of both houses of Parliament
